name: Nausea
description:
'''Nausea''' was an American [[crust punk]] band from New York City, active from 1985 to 1992. They are cited as a notable band in the first wave of [[crust punk]].{{citation needed|date=December 2020}}

Prior to Nausea, guitarist Victor Dominicis played in the hardcore punk bands Hellbent and Sacrilege. Nausea were involved in the New York City [[Lower East Side]] [[squatting]] community.{{citation needed|date=December 2020}} Their earlier sound with singers Amy Miret and Neil Robinson was in the vein of [[hardcore punk]].{{citation needed|date=December 2020}} After Robinson's departure, he was replaced by Al Long and the band began to experiment with darker, [[heavy metal music|metal]] influences.{{citation needed|date=December 2020}} Robinson went on to form the bands Jesus Crust and Final Warning, as well as start [[Tribal War Records]].
